step1.sentence: Volunteers stood at the entrance giving out water bottles to the arriving runners.

step2.story: The phone battery gave out just as she was about to call for directions. She had to ask a passerby instead and ended up finding the place with no trouble.

step3.story: The community center had prepared five hundred flyers for the local fair and sent a team of volunteers to give them out downtown. By noon, all the flyers were gone and people were still asking for more. The team called the center, printed another batch, and were back out in an hour. By the end of the day, the fair had its highest registration in ten years.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 여러 사람에게 나눠주다; 에너지나 자원이 다 소진되다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 물건을 여럿에게 배포하거나, 에너지나 기계가 다 떨어지거나 고장날 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: give(주다)와 out(밖으로, 전부)이 결합하여 바깥쪽으로 모두 내어준다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 나눠주다의 의미로는 distribute와 비슷합니다. 기계나 신체가 소진될 때는 break down과 유사합니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: The teacher gave out worksheets at the start of every class.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 선생님은 매 수업 시작할 때 학습지를 나눠줬어요.
